oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Abstract of Infantry Tactics, 1830
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Abstract of Infantry Tactics Including Exercises and Manuevers of Light-Infantry and Riflemen for the Use of the Militia of the United States. The frontispiece bears the inscription "Land warrant No. 47092 Thos. Duncan 15 Febry, 1849. By T. Denson; to Sarah Abrams 18 June 1849. This book of tactics is often referred to as "Scott's Tactics" as it was primarly written by General Winfield Scott. With some modifications, it was the primary manual for the US Army from the 1820s until the late 1850s.
